thread.title: 1 Dead, 3 Injured In Borough Park Gas Explosion
thread.title_full: 1 Dead, 3 Injured In Borough Park Gas Explosion

author: Suzanne Vega
title: 1 Dead, 3 Injured In Borough Park Gas Explosion
text:
Share REUTERS/Stephanie Keith 
One person is dead and three people are injured after a building, located at 4206 13 Ave., in Borough Park, Brooklyn caught on fire Saturday afternoon. 
Authorities say the 911 call came in around 1 p.m. after a gas explosion, which blew off the front of the building, was heard and black smoke began to surge from the opening. 
The fire spread quickly to the adjoining building, damaging apartments and a warehouse store, whose owner is in Israel for Sukkot. 
People were seen running away from the fire and over 100 firefighters responded to the scene. Fire trucks and police vehicles blocked the road for a block in every direction. 
A witness at the scene said that two civilians, a father and son, were hit by falling debris while returning from prayer. A firefighter is also being treated for minor injuries. They were all transported to Methodist Hospital. 
Gov. Andrew Cuomo offered a statement, following similar explosions in East Harlem and the East Village earlier this year. He stated he intends to direct the state Department of Public Service to investigate the cause of the explosion. 
“This explosion is the latest in a disturbing trend of incidents that occurred in Harlem and the East Village,” he said. “On behalf of all New Yorkers, my thoughts and prayers are with those who have been impacted by today’s explosion, especially the friends and family of those lost or injured.” 
City Department of Buildings staffers are to assess the damage. National Grid said they were responding to the scene and working under the direction of the FDNY to shut off gas in the area, CBS2 reported. REUTERS/Stephanie Keith
